comment.author: 56731723@N02
comment._content: That's a great historical image. The leading ship looks like a Connecticut-Class pre-dreadnought battleship. She looks like the Conneticut (BB-18) or the Louisiana (BB-19), which were indeed part of the 1907 world voyage. The Connecticut was the lead ship of the Great White Fleet.

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/photography-by-thomas] Thanks for the info! We have updated out catalogue record to include this information. It is an amazing photograph - glad you liked it!

comment._content: The leading ship is really USS Connecticut.
